# NSExtensionRequestHandling

**Protocol**

The interface an app extension uses to respond to a request from a host app.

## Declaration

```swift
protocol NSExtensionRequestHandling : NSObjectProtocol
```

## Overview

The [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSExtensionRequestHandling] protocol provides a life cycle hook into an app extension. An extension’s principal object can implement this protocol and use [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSExtensionRequestHandling/beginRequest(with:)] to keep track of the request from a host app.

## Preparing for a request

- **beginRequest(with:)**: Tells the extension to prepare for a host app’s request.

## Extension Support

- **NSExtensionContext**: The host app context from which an app extension is invoked.

## Inherits From

- NSObjectProtocol
